title: Rageblade...
body:
Probably going to get downvoted to oblivion, but can Rageblade not lose all it's stacks when the timer for the Unique passive goes down? Can it tick down like Jax's passive? I pretty much have to attack minions nearby to get the value worth of Rageblade which is worth almost the same price as Trinity Force.

EDIT: Oh my! I didn't expect this thread to blow up like this. Thank you for the feedback <3 I appreciate it.

replies.body: can it not cost so much.

can it be viable on melee champions

and not break kog'maw
Ask yourself do Melees actually get to auto something 6 times in an actual fight? There's your answer
There's the problem. Damage should be nerfed across the board. It skews ranged champs and forces low mobility melees to be broken in order to be remotely viable.

Which is why it should be 3 autos for melee ffs

~~4*~~ it is 6 wtf. 3 boiz

4.

8 stacks for ranged.
Can melees even auto in actual fights?
If you think it breaks kog maw then you need to see kayle too xD
Kayle isn't actually as strong with Rageblade.

Yeah, it's too hard to stack up for the duration of most fights. In theory, she can build AP/AS and take advantage of the 50% increase in on-hit damage to make up for the lack of crit... but in practice, by the time she has six stacks on rageblade the fight is over (either by death or disengage).

In practice, the highest damage Kayle builds are AD/AS with Smite and Bloodrazor. The only thing you lose out on is extra movespeed buff from AP scaling on W, since you have sustain from lifesteal and everything else scales with AD in some fashion... and if you're willing to give up some true damage, you can just take blue enchant.

Turns out that an ADC with a 15% shred and 3s invulnerability is pretty painful to fight.

You wouldn't rush it, however using rageblade for second or third item is hella strong. I do it every time and the Koreans appear to do it too.


The damage it does in the end is nasty, and keeping it up isnt hard since all you do is splitpush from range anyway.

I play Kayle. I know exactly what I'm talking about.

60 +30% AP onhit damage doesn't exactly scale well, which is why most ADCs out scale Kayle's DPS, especially with better Pen items.

Reason marksmen outscale kayle is because they use crit....that fundamentally outscales everything.


Not to mention they have monsters like {{champion:67}}  among them.....nothing outscales Vayne. 

But at 2 items or even 3 few can beat kayle, she is hella strong 1v1.


And unlike most marksmen she can go invincible and still deal damage albeit only for a brief moment.  However that moment is priceless many times. 

However just like most splitpushers she does not enjoy getting CC'ed thus avoiding teamfights and picking 1v1's is the common choice.

Thus there is no need to worry about marksmen^^


That's how the Koreans seem to view it at least, i only play her from time to time when needing a splitter and having the liberty of picking a squishy toplane.  So i can't call myself an expert but i do have won a lot more than i lost on her.....mainly normals though as i am more confident with Jax for ranked in toplane.

why did you remind me of the season 6 kogmaw :( 
Rip koggy the machinegun
Evelynn is actually the best with it. Jax not too bad either. Both use it better than Kog. Most melee (with a titanic) are good with it.
Jax never buys Rageblade.

would like it if they removed the (15 magic damage on-hit) passive for another effect.

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

Why, though? It builds out of the on-hit component item and gives it some base effectiveness with its own Phantom Hit passive.

In fact, Rageblade would do nothing on its own without it.
Most people would not consider that "removing the on-hit magic damage," they would consider that _buffing_ it.
that works too although Im not sure how much buffing you can really give the item before it becomes a must-buy on anyone who right clicks.

Rageblade can be hilariously when combined with {{item:1419}} {{item:3153}} on {{champion:11}} and you have it stacked on a tower then some pleb (typically a tank) walks into your melee range to "stop" you.

But apart from that it's entirely useless in teamfights as you'll win the teamfight before you can make good use of the stacks or instantly die and not be able to stack it at all, even more so an a squishy melee ADC.
I miss the ravenous hydra style splash.
Me too. That shit was fun on kayle
it was fun on yi :(

NO. 
You sadistic bastard. I was new and this interaction gave me nightmares
_cough_{{champion:81}} _cough_
This item sorely needs to be buffed for melee champs in some way.
Would probably break kayle.
I mean this item is basically just a KogMaw item, and with his range he has no problem stacking them in teamfights.
Don't some Varus players use it too?
Apart from Kog'Maw it is also a must on Kayle and it is built a lot of times on Jax, and on Master Yi when he isn't building crit.
Jax doesn't build Rageblade ever.

Who are you using it on if I may ask?

I tried it on Morde a while back and it felt very powerful when I could melee something.  At the end I started building Ohmwrecker with it so I could stay charged on a tower to bait an enemy in before shutting off the tower and dumping my damage while I'm safe.

Mmm. I like your cheese tactic.

Mine for Morde is Gunblade Rageblade with exaust and ignite. You can't be 1 vs 1ed and can barely be ganked. You have enough AD to melt towers, burst with Q, hit hard with e, and enough AP for fat heals and a nice burn on your ult. With Rageblade stacking, your Q is similar to the post rework Q in how it keeps getting stronger, as well as your heals in sustained fights.

My typical 3rd item with that core is Triforce or Ludens, for the MS so I can stick. Triforce is more safe because of the all around stats and Sheen resonance with the AD, but Ludens is a sustain powerspike.

I stumbled on your post describing that build.  Good theory crafting on that one, just a shame it looked like people wanted to wave a ranked 'That doesn't work' at it rather than talk about it.  The tone may have changed however since last I saw it was 2 or so days back.  

Don't get me wrong, I love the feel of gunblade whenever I do buy it but feel it's only a solid pick up when I can build lots and lots of resistances.  Things like frozen heart and stoneplate are must haves for getting the most out of gunblade.

Personal preference is rageblade into titanic hydra while weaving in some extra resists and code.  From there frozen mallet gives a huge boost in damage if you know the secret to triggering titanic.

I used to do Titanic on Morde. This reply had me try it again last night. Titanic does NOT auto attack reset any if your Qs, BUT you can AA, AA reset your non Q AA, than activate Q for another AA. (AA, Titanic AA reset, first Q AA reset) The interaction is Interesting, and I may start using it more with my AD builds once I master the AA reset.

Gunblade is neat on Morde as It gives his Q the most damage, and notable sustain (that DoT heal from w and ult, oh yes). Rageblade is very strong on Morde IF you can stick, so throw mobility in your build, and use exaust over flash. It can turn tides and allow you to get enough AAS off to keep Rageblade stacked.

Yeah, that's a good combo but try this one when you have some time and tell me what you think wont you?  With rageblade and titanic, AA three times, start your Q to reset the AA and on the last swing trigger titanic.  If you time it all right the last hit should be a massive magic damage hit from Q linked up with a double proc of titanic.  Its very powerful and because titanic doesn't AA reset with your Q you can change targets and dump all your damage on a much softer target.

At first I didn't understand, but let's see if I got this right: AA 3 times to stack Rageblade a bit. Than AA reset with first Q, than once 3rd Q hits (since you can't AA reset on your 3 Q's with Titanic), you AA reset with Titanic to get a fully stacked Rageblade AA off? I can imagine this is kickass, great theorycraft!  I feel that with Triforce for Sheen proc and Steraks, it could be a really nice build, with all around synergy.

Yep, it hits super hard on that last attack.  I could see Trinity Force helping the damage alot, though I worry about durability after my damage items of Rageblade Titanic and Frozen Mallet.

Been spending my breaks fiddling with ideas to keep tanky but there is always something  missing from my builds be it the CDR I need for procs or durability when I do find lots of damage.  Cant wait for the new runes to see what we can play with.

My problem with Guinsoo on Mordekaiser is that it is too expensive and he can't really make a lot of use from it, Morde doesn't have on-hit effects and he can't stick to people for long enough to not lose the Guinsoo stacks.

He makes fantastic use of all stats from its item though. If he had a way to stick to enemies, this item could be a viable choice, if only for the stats.

(his Q is not an on-hit effect, it is an on-attack effect that works similar to Nasus' Q and cannot be doubled by Phantom Hit)

This is I take exaust on Morde a lot. I get more utility,  and better cooldown with it. It allows me to stick, keeping up guinsoos, and don't forget Morde stacks it faster than most and has hidden rsnge ( 675 e, 1000 w, global DoT ult)

I'd recommend frozen mallet if your looking to keep on people with rageblade.  Titanic hydra is all you really need in terms of on hit damage to make rageblade feel great.  It's tricky to get the timing right but titanic and rageblade have a devastating combo if you can link it with your 3rd Q.

Why not use Rylai then?

Frozen Mallet has a stronger slow but it only works on autos. You need to actually get to them to begin with. With Rylai you can ult them for a ranged, constant slow.

True, but I find the larger slow more useful than a spamable one that can be foiled with any set of second level boots on its own.  The extra HP on mallet is a boon too as it fuels titanic much better than rylai's does.  With stats aside it's all down to how creatively you can get next to an opponent and it's not hard to get next to at least one guy in a fight.

I did build it for fun on vayne before for shits and giggles.

And time to time I build it on Warwick as well since it does benefit him in everyway

I can't comment much for SR but Rageblade is absolutely broken for Invasion. You are constantly attacking stuff all the time though, so obviously that skews it weird. 

Seriously, Invasion PSA: don't buy regular stuff on marksman. Buy Rageblade, Bork, Wit's End. Especially on this guy {{sticker:sg-ezreal}}
